revised_title: Effects of Polycyclic Hydrocarbons on Transplantable Tumour Growth
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the effects of various polycyclic hydrocarbons on the growth rate of transplantable tumours in rats. They found that certain carcinogenic hydrocarbons, such as 1:2:5:6-dibenzanthracene, significantly inhibited the growth of tumours, while non-carcinogenic hydrocarbons had no such effect. This research contributed to the understanding of how cancer-causing substances can influence tumour growth.
